member.name: T:DotRas.CredentialPromptDialog
member.summary: Prompts the user for credentials. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: The property should contain the name of the server or machine for which credentials are being requested. This dialog also ties into the Windows credential store to pre-populate the user name if the stored credentials are found.

This class uses the Network Access: Do not allow storage of credentials or .NET passports for network authentication policy setting. If this policy is enabled, the dialog will not be able to persist credentials.

list.item: This component is only available on Windows XP and later operating systems.

member.summary: The internet interface has come online and the connection is switching over to this new interface.

member.summary: The connection has switched over successfully to the new internet interface.

member.name: T:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RasDialFunc2
member.summary: The callback used by the RasDial function when a change of state occurs during a remote access connection process.
member.param: An application defined value that was passed to the remote access service.
The one-based subentry index for the phone book entry associated with this connection.
The handle to the connection.
The type of event that has occurred.
The state the remote access connection process is about to enter.
The error that has occurred. If no error has occurred the value is zero.
Any extended error information for certain non-zero values of .
member.returns: true to continue to receive callback notifications, otherwise false.

The event that occurred.
A string whose value depends on the parameter.
Pointer to an additional buffer argument whose value depends on the parameter.

member.name: T:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS
member.summary: Defines the credential user interface flags.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.None
member.summary: No flags have been specified.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.IncorrectPassword
member.summary: Notify the user of insufficient credentials by displaying the 'Logon unsuccessful' balloon tip.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.DoNotPersist
member.summary: Do not store credentials or display check boxes. You can pass CREDUI_FLAGS_SHOW_SAVE_CHECK_BOX with this flag to display the Save check box only, and the result is returned in the pfSave output parameter.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.RequestAdministrator
member.summary: Populate the combo box with local administrators only.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.ExcludeCertificates
member.summary: Populate the combo box with user name/password only. Do not display certificates or smart cards in the combo box.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.RequireCertificate
member.summary: Populate the combo box with certificates and smart cards only. Do not allow a user name to be entered.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.ShowSaveCheckBox
member.summary: If the check box is selected, show the Save check box and return TRUE in the pfSave output parameter, otherwise, return FALSE. Check box uses the value in pfSave by default.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.AlwaysShowUI
member.summary: Specifies that a user interface will be shown even if the credentials can be returned from an existing credential in credential manager. This flag is permitted only if CREDUI_FLAGS_GENERIC_CREDENTIALS is also specified.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.RequireSmartCard
member.summary: Populate the combo box with certificates or smart cards only. Do not allow a user name to be entered.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.PasswordOnlyOK
member.summary: Undocumented flag.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.ValidateUserName
member.summary: Undocumented flag.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.CompleteUserName
member.summary: Undocumented flag.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.Persist
member.summary: Do not show the Save check box, but the credential is saved as though the box were shown and selected.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.ServerCredential
member.summary: When this flag is specified, wildcard credentials will not be matched.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.ExpectConfirmation
member.summary: Do not persist unless caller later confirms credential via the CredUIConfirmCredential API.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.GenericCredentials
member.summary: Consider the credentials entered by the user to be generic credentials.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.UserNameTargetCredentials
member.summary: The credential is a "run-as" credential. The TargetName parameter specifies the name of the command or program being run. It is used for prompting purposes only.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.KeepUserName
member.summary: Do not allow the user to change the supplied username.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.None
member.summary: No entry options specified.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.UseCountryAndAreaCodes
member.summary: The country id, country code, and area code members are used to construct the phone number.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.SpecificIPAddress
member.summary: The IP address specified by the entry will be used for the connection.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.SpecificNameServers
member.summary: The DNS addresses and WINS addresses specified by the entry will be used for the connection.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.IPHeaderCompression
member.summary: IP header compression will be used on PPP (Point-to-point) connections.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RemoteDefaultGateway
member.summary: The default route for IP packets is through the dial-up adapter while the connection is active.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.DisableLcpExtensions
member.summary: The remote access service (RAS) will disable the PPP LCP extensions.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.TerminalBeforeDial
member.summary: The remote access service (RAS) displays a terminal window for user input before dialing the connection.
member.remarks: This member is only used when the entry is dialed by the component.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.TerminalAfterDial
member.summary: The remote access service displays a terminal window for user input after dialing the connection.
member.remarks: This member is only used when the entry is dialed by the component.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.ModemLights
member.summary: The remote access service (RAS) will display a status monitor in the taskbar.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.SoftwareCompression
member.summary: The software compression will be negotiated by the link.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RequireEncryptedPassword
member.summary: Only secure password schemes can be used to authenticate the client with the server.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RequireMSEncryptedPassword
member.summary: Only the Microsoft secure password scheme (MSCHAP) can be used to authenticate the client with the server.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RequireDataEncryption
member.summary: Data encryption must be negotiated successfully or the connection should be dropped.
member.remarks: This flag is ignored unless is also set.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.NetworkLogOn
member.summary: The remote access service (RAS) logs on to the network after the point-to-point connection is established.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.UseLogOnCredentials
member.summary: The remote access service (RAS) uses the username, password, and domain of the currently logged on user when dialing this entry.
member.remarks: This flag is ignored unless the is also set.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.PromoteAlternates
member.summary: Indicates when an alternate phone number connects successfully, that number will become the primary phone number.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.SecureLocalFiles
member.summary: Check for an existing remote file system and remote printer bindings before making a connection to this phone book entry.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RequireEap
member.summary: Indicates the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RequirePap
member.summary: Indicates the Password Authentication Protocol (PAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RequireSpap
member.summary: Indicates Shiva's Password Authentication Protocol (SPAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.Custom
member.summary: The connection will use custom encryption.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.PreviewPhoneNumber
member.summary: The remote access dialer should display the phone number being dialed.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.SharedPhoneNumbers
member.summary: Indicates all modems on the computer will share the same phone number.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.PreviewUserPassword
member.summary: The remote access dialer should display the username and password prior to dialing.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.PreviewDomain
member.summary: The remote access dialer should display the domain name prior to dialing.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.ShowDialingProgress
member.summary: The remote access dialer will display its progress while establishing the connection.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RequireChap
member.summary: Indicates the Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RequireMSChap
member.summary: Indicates the Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RequireMSChap2
member.summary: Indicates the Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) version 2 must be supported for authentication.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.RequireWin95MSChap
member.summary: Indicates MSCHAP must also send the LanManager hashed password.
member.remarks: This flag requires that must also be set.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO.CustomScript
member.summary: The remote access service (RAS) must invoke a custom scripting assembly after establishing a connection to the server.

member.name: T:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.None
member.summary: No additional entry options specified.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.SecureFileAndPrint
member.summary: Prevents remote users from using file and print servers over the connection.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.SecureClientForMSNet
member.summary: Equivalent of clearing the Client for Microsoft Networks checkbox in the connection properties dialog box on the networking tab.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.DoNotNegotiateMultilink
member.summary: Changes the default behavior to not negotiate multilink.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.DoNotUseRasCredentials
member.summary: Use the default credentials to access network resources.

member.summary: Use a pre-shared key for IPSec authentication.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.Internet
member.summary: Indicates the connection is to the Internet.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.DisableNbtOverIP
member.summary: Disables NBT probing for this connection.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.UseGlobalDeviceSettings

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.ReconnectIfDropped
member.summary: Automatically attempts to re-establish the connection if the connection is lost.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.SharePhoneNumbers
member.summary: Use the same set of phone numbers for all subentries in a multilink connection.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.SecureRoutingCompartment
member.summary: Indicates the routing compartments feature is enabled.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.IPv6SpecificNameServer
member.summary: Uses the IPv6 DNS address and alternate DNS address for the connection.

member.summary: Indicates the default route for IPv6 packets is through the PPP connection when the connection is active.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.RegisterIPWithDns

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.UseDnsSuffixForRegistration
member.summary: The DNS suffix for this connection should be used for DNS registration.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.IPv4ExplicitMetric
member.summary: Indicates the administrator is allowed to statically set the interface metric of the IPv4 stack for this interface.

member.name: F:DotRas.Internal.NativeMethods.RASEO2.IPv6ExplicitMetric
member.summary: Indicates the administrator is allowed to statically set the interface metric of the IPv6 stack for this interface.

member.name: T:DotRas.RasConnectionWatcher
member.summary: Listens to the remote access service (RAS) change notifications and raises events when connections change. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: When using RasConnectionWatcher to monitor active connections for changes, ensure the SynchronizingObject property is set if thread synchronization is required. If this is not done, you may get cross-thread exceptions thrown from the component. This is typically needed with applications that have an interface; for example, Windows Forms or Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

The connected event raised by this component will be raised whenever a connection has connected on the machine. If a valid handle is provided to the property, the other events will only receive notifications for that handle however the connected event will remain unchanged.

member.name: T:DotRas.RasDialer
member.summary: Provides an interface to the remote access service (RAS) dialer. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: Failure to dispose of this component may result in a connection attempt hanging, which will require the machine to be restarted before the connection is released.

When using RasDialer to dial connections asynchronously, ensure the SynchronizingObject property is set if thread synchronization is required. If this is not done, you may get cross-thread exceptions thrown from the component. This is typically needed with applications that have an interface; for example, Windows Forms or Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

If an exception occurs while processing an event while dialing asynchronously, that exception will be raised through the Error event on RasDialer. This approach allows the application to continue processing the notifications from Windows, which would otherwise cause the state machine to be corrupted and require the machine to be rebooted.
The events raised by this component occur only during a dialing operation, if you need to monitor connection changes made outside of dialing a connection use the component.

list.item: Due to limitations with Windows, RasDialer cannot handle expired passwords or have the ability to change a password while connecting.
This component can only handle dialing one connection at a time. If your application needs to dial multiple connections simultaneously, use multiple instances of the component.

member.remarks: If the entry is stored in a custom location or the current users profile, the credentials cannot be stored in the all users profile. However, if an entry is stored in the all users profile then the credentials may be stored in the current users profile or the all users profile.

member.name: T:DotRas.RasPhoneBook
member.summary: Represents a remote access service (RAS) phone book. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: When using RasPhoneBook to monitor a phone book for external changes, ensure the SynchronizingObject property is set if thread synchronization is required. If this is not done, you may get cross-thread exceptions thrown from the component. This is typically needed with applications that have an interface; for example, Windows Forms or Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

There are multiple phone books in use by Windows at any given point in time and this class can only manage one phone book per instance. If you add an entry to the all user's profile phone book, attempting to manipulate it with the current user's profile phone book opened will result in failure. Entries will not be located, and changes made to the phone book will not be recognized by the instance.

When attempting to open a phone book that does not yet exist, the RasPhoneBook class will automatically generate the file to be used. Also, setting the property to true will allow the class to monitor for any external changes made to the file.

list.item: For phone books which are not located in the all users profile directory (including those in custom locations) any stored credentials for the entries must be stored per user.

The RasPhoneBook component may not be able to modify entries in the All User's profile without elevated application privileges. If your application cannot request elevated privileges you can either use the current user profile phone book, or use a custom phone book in a path that will not require elevated permissions.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.Clone
member.summary: Creates a copy of this object.
member.returns: A new object.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.UseCountryAndAreaCodes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the country and area codes are used to construct the phone number.
member.remarks: This value corresponds to the Use dialing rules checkbox on the connection properties dialog box.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.IPHeaderCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether IP header compression will be used on PPP (Point-to-Point) connections.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RemoteDefaultGateway
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote default gateway will be used.
member.remarks: This value corresponds to the Use default gateway on remote network checkbox in the TCP/IP settings dialog box.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.DisableLcpExtensions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service will disable the PPP LCP extensions.
member.remarks: This option causes RAS to disable the PPP LCP extensions defined in RFC 1570. This may be necessary for certain older PPP implementations, but interferes with features such as server callback. Do not set this option unless specifically required.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.TerminalBeforeDial
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service displays a terminal window for user input before dialing the connection.
member.remarks: This option only works if the entry is dialed by the component. This option has no effect if the entry is dialed by .

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.TerminalAfterDial
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service displays a terminal window for user input after dialing the connection.
member.remarks: This option only works if the entry is dialed by the component. This option has no effect if the entry is dialed by .

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.ModemLights
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service will display a status monitor in the taskbar.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.SoftwareCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether software compression will be negotiated by the link.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequireEncryptedPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether only secure password schemes can be used to authenticate the client.

remarks.para: If this option is set, only secure password schemes can be used to authenticate the client with the server. This prevents the PPP driver from using the PAP plain-text authentication protocol (PAP) to authenticate the client, however MD5-CHAP and SPAP are supported. Clear this option for increased interoperability, and set it for increased security. Setting this option also sets the , , , and options.
This option corresponds to the Require Encrypted Password checkbox in the Security settings dialog box.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequireMSEncryptedPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether only the Microsoft secure password scheme (MSCHAP) can be used to authenticate the client.

remarks.para: If this option is set, only the Microsoft secure password scheme, MSCHAP, can be used to authenticate the client with the server. This flag prevents the PPP driver from using the PPP plain-text authentication protocol (PAP), MD5-CHAP, or SPAP. Setting this option also sets the and options.
This option corresponds to the Require Microsoft Encrypted Password checkbox in the Security settings dialog box.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequireDataEncryption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether data encryption must be negotiated successfully or the connection should be dropped.

remarks.para: This option corresponds to the Require Data Encryption checkbox in the Security settings dialog box.
This option is ignored unless the option is also set.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.NetworkLogOn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service logs onto the network after the PPP (Point-to-Point) connection is established.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.UseLogOnCredentials
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access uses the currently logged on user credentials when dialing this entry.

remarks.para: This option corresponds to the Use Current Username and Password checkbox in the Security settings dialog box.
This option is ignored unless the option is also set.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.PromoteAlternates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether alternate numbers are promoted to the primary number when connected successfully.
member.remarks: This option corresponds to the Move successful numbers to the top of the list checkbox in the AlterNate Phone Numbers dialog box.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.SecureLocalFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an existing remote file system and remote printer bindings are located before making a connection.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequireEap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequirePap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Password Authentication Protocol (PAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequireSpap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Shiva's Password Authentication Protocol (SPAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.CustomEncryption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the connection will use custom encryption.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.PreviewPhoneNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access dialer should display the phone number being dialed.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.SharedPhoneNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether all modems on the computer will share the same phone number.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.PreviewUserPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access dialer should display the username and password prior to dialing.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.PreviewDomain
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access dialer should display the domain name prior to dialing.
member.remarks: This option corresponds to the Include Windows logon domain checkbox in the connection properties dialog box.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.ShowDialingProgress
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access dialer should display its progress while establishing the connection.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequireChap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequireMSChap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Microsoft Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (MSCHAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequireMSChap2
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Microsoft Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (MSCHAP) version 2 must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequireWin95MSChap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether MSCHAP must also send the LAN Manager hashed password.
member.remarks: This option also requires the option is set.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.CustomScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service must invoke a custom scripting assembly after establishing a connection.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.SecureFileAndPrint
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users will be prevented from using file and print servers over the connection.

remarks.para: This option is the equivalent of clearing the File and Print Sharing for Microsoft Networks checkbox in the connection properties dialog box.
Windows XP and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.SecureClientForMSNet
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the client will be secured for Microsoft networks.

remarks.para: This option is the equivalent of clearing the Client for Microsoft Networks checkbox in the connection properties dialog box.
Windows XP and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.DoNotNegotiateMultilink
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the default behavior is not to negotiate multilink.

remarks.para: This option is the equivalent of clearing the Negotiate multi-link for single-link connection checkbox in the connection properties dialog box on the PPP settings dialog.
Windows XP and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.DoNotUseRasCredentials
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the default credentials to access network resources.
member.remarks: Windows XP and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.UsePreSharedKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a pre-shared key is used for IPSec authentication.
member.remarks: Windows XP and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.Internet
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the entry connects to the Internet.
member.remarks: Windows XP and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.DisableNbtOverIP
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether NBT probing is disabled for this connection.
member.remarks: Windows XP and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.UseGlobalDeviceSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the global device settings will be used by the entry.

remarks.para: This option causes the entry device to be ignored.
Windows XP and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.ReconnectIfDropped
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service should attempt to re-establish the connection if the connection is lost.

remarks.para: This option corresponds to the Redial if line is dropped checkbox in the connection properties dialog box.
Windows XP and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.SharePhoneNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the same set of phone numbers are used for all subentries in a multilink connection.

remarks.para: This option corresponds to the All devices use the same number checkbox in the connection properties dialog box.
Windows XP and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.SecureRoutingCompartment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the routing compartments feature is enabled.
member.remarks: Windows Vista and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.UseTypicalSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a connection should be configured to use the typical settings for authentication and encryption.
member.remarks: Windows Vista and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.IPv6RemoteDefaultGateway
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote default gateway will be used on an IPv6 connection.
member.remarks: Windows Vista and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RegisterIPWithDns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the IP address should be registered with the DNS server when connected.
member.remarks: Windows Vista and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.UseDnsSuffixForRegistration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the DNS suffix for this connection should be used for DNS registration.
member.remarks: Windows Vista and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.DisableIkeNameEkuCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the IKE validation check will not be performed.
member.remarks: Windows Vista and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.DisableClassBasedStaticRoute
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a class based route based on the VPN interface IP address will not be added.
member.remarks: Windows 7 and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.DisableMobility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the client will not be able to change the external IP address of the IKEv2 VPN connection.
member.remarks: Windows 7 and later: This property is available.

member.name: P:DotRas.RasEntryOptions.RequireMachineCertificates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether machine certificates are used for IKEv2 authentication.
member.remarks: Windows 7 and later: This property is available.
